moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. c3 dxc3 4. Bc4 cx: Woo hoo he accepted the whole thing!
moves.5... d6 6. Qd5: ? Probably not very good, but I was trying to put pressure on him and it was blitz. But this was bad as it allowed him to develop with tempo.
moves.6... Be6 7. Qb5+: ? I don't think this is great.
moves.7... Nc6: ? Tempting to develop, but I think Pc6 would be better.
moves.8. Nf3 Be7 9. Nbd2 Nf6 10. e5: Trying to squeeze him a little.
moves.10... dxe5 11. Bxe6 fxe6: Look at his poor, isolated, doubled, e pawns, easy to pick off.
moves.13... bxc6 14. Qxc6: His position is in tatters. While he is still up a pawn, he has *four* different pawn islands, and three isolated pawns. White, has two pawn islands and one isolated pawn. White is also more active.
moves.14... Bb4 15. Rd1 Bxd2+: ? Here he played what I hoped he'd do.
moves.16. Rxd2 Qc8 17. Qf3: I look for a way to pick off a pawn.
moves.17... Qe8: He's shuffling his pieces around the back row.
moves.18... Qa4 19. Qe3: Threatens e6 and also lays a little trap...
moves.19... Qxa2: ?? Looks tempting doesn't it, a free pawn and defending your pawn at the same time sounds pretty good right?
moves.20... Qa5 21. Qxe6+: He does not have long to live.
moves.21... Rf7 22. Rd7: I pile up on the pinned rook.
moves.22... Raf8 23. Be7: ! With this move, he resigns. Please comment and rate.
